intro: Anaphalioides, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, pale, often white or pinkish flowers that resemble ghostly apparitions, hence its common name. The plants typically have narrow, linear leaves and are often found in dry, open habitats. Anaphalioides species are native to regions of Africa, southern Europe, and parts of Asia. They are generally short-lived perennial herbs with a compact growth habit.
